pkgmetadata.longdescription: Pastel: Bring colors to your terminal#####################################Pastel is a simple library to help you colorize strings in your terminal.It comes bundled with predefined styles:* ``info``: green* ``comment``: yellow* ``question``: black on cyan* ``error``: white on red.. image:: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sdispater/pastel/master/assets/screenshot.pngFeatures========* Use predefined styles or add you own.* Disable colors all together by calling ``with_colors(False)``.* Automatically disables colors if the output is not a TTY.* Used in `cleo <https://github.com/sdispater/cleo>`_.* Supports Python **2.7+**, **3.5+** and **PyPy**.Usage=====.. code-block:: python >>> import pastel >>> print(pastel.colorize('<info>Information</info>')) 'Information' # Green string by default >>> print(pastel.colorize('<fg=red;options=bold>This is bold red</>')) 'This is bold red'Installation============.. code-block:: pip install pastel
